means: 改变( transform的过去式和过去分词 )
使改变形态，使改变外观（或性质），使改观

sentence.Network_en: A cheap table can be transformed by an interesting cover.
sentence.Network_cn: 一块趣味盎然的桌布就能使一张廉价桌子面目一新。

sentence.Network_en: Filmmaking was transformed by digital editing, digital f/x, and digicams.
sentence.Network_cn: 数字剪辑、数码特效以及数码摄像机改变了电影摄制方式。

sentence.Network_en: The very basis of Indian politics has been transformed.
sentence.Network_cn: 甚至于印度的政治基础都被改变了。

entry.def: To transform something into something else means to change or convert it into that thing.

example.ex: Your metabolic rate is the speed at which your body transforms food into energy...
example.tran: 新陈代谢率是身体把食物转换为能量的速度。

example.ex: Delegates also discussed transforming them from a guerrilla force into a regular army.
example.tran: 代表们还讨论了把他们从游击队武装改造为正规军的问题。

entry.tran: 改善;使改观;使改头换面
entry.def: To transform something or someone means to change them completely and suddenly so that they are much better or more attractive.

example.ex: The Minister said the Urban Development Corporation was now transforming the area...
example.tran: 部长声称城市开发公司如今正使该地区改头换面。

example.ex: A cheap table can be transformed by an interesting cover…
example.tran: 一块趣味盎然的桌布就能使一张廉价桌子面目一新。

means.word_mean: 1. given a completely different form or appearance;

auth_sentence.content: Twice a day, Grand Central Terminal is transformed.
auth_sentence.res_content: Twice a day, Grand Central Terminal is transformed.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Twice a day, Grand Central Terminal is transformed.

auth_sentence.content: This earthly joy was being...transformed into a heavenly joy.
auth_sentence.res_content: This earthly joy was being...transformed into a heavenly joy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This earthly joy was being...transformed into a heavenly joy.

auth_sentence.content: The semiconductor has transformed every industry it's touched.
auth_sentence.res_content: The semiconductor has transformed every industry it's touched.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The semiconductor has transformed every industry it's touched.

Sentence.sentence: Government's failure to perform this role in the early 1930s transformed recession into depression.
By the end of the decade, both visions had yielded concrete results and transformed American society
Even apart from the increased competition, the kids enter a process that has been utterly transformed from the one baby boomers knew.
